Study: Aerosol and surface stability of HCoV-19 (SARS-CoV-2) compared to SARS-CoV-1 (medRxiv)
Persistence: aerosols: 3 hrs plastic: 72 hrs stainless steel: 72 hrs copper: 4 hrs cardboard: 24 hrs
TCID50/mL: aerosols: 10^3.5 to 10^2.7(3 hrs); plastic: 10^3.7 to 10^0.6(72hrs); stainless steel: 10^3.7 to 10^0.6(48 hrs); No viable virus could be measured after 4 hours on copper; No viable virus could be measured after 24 hours on cardboard
Half Life (median): aerosols: 1.09 hrs; plastic: 6.81 hrs; stainless steel: 5.63 hrs; copper: 0.774 hrs; cardboard: 3.46 hrs

Study: Persistence of coronaviruses on inanimate surfaces and their inactivation with biocidal agents (The Journal of Hospital Infection)
